Key Match Events: Ross Adair hit a century (100) from 57 balls
Paul Stirling contributed 52 runs from 31 balls with 7 fours and a six
Reeza Hendricks and Matthew Breetzke set up a victory platform with 51 runs each
Mark Adair took 4 wickets for 31 runs in 4 overs
Graeme Hume took 3 wickets for 25 runs in 4 overs
South Africa's bowling was described as erratic
South Africa's batting decision-making in the closing stages was chaotic
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland's all-round performance was described as magnificent
Captain Aiden Markram (8) missed a reverse sweep and was bowled
Ireland was unable to capitalise on a foundation which promised a total well in excess of 200
South Africa comfortably won the first match by 8 wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ross Adair was given a costly life on 19 but made the most of it
Adair's record-breaking innings should have ended on 19 due to a no-ball
Dockrell finished unbeaten on 20 from 13 balls
Nobody in the lower order was able to provide the finishing momentum required in the final overs
Williams (4-0-35-1) and Mulder (4-0-51-2) were far from their best
Spinners Fortuin (2-0-24-0) and Nqaba Peter (2-0-29-0) suffered badly at the hands of the openers
